channel.title: Go on Donia Chaiehloudj
channel.description: Recent content in Go on Donia Chaiehloudj

item.title: eBPF with Go: The Foundation of Modern Kubernetes Networking
item.description: Demystifying eBPF by exploring how Go makes it accessible, with practical demos of tracing, XDP packet filtering, and Cilium networking.

item.title: An Intro to eBPF with Go: The Foundation of Modern Kubernetes Networking
item.description: Demystifying eBPF by exploring how Go makes it accessible - with practical demos of tracing, XDP packet filtering, and Cilium networking.

item.title: Mastering Hardware Programming, Go, & Networking in Embedded Systems
item.description: Discussing my journey in hardware programming, why Go is a game-changer for embedded development, and tackling networking challenges in IoT.

item.title: Je vois des Gophers partout
item.description: √âpisode 12 du podcast Tranches de Tech o√π je discute de Go, TinyGo, mon livre Manning, eBPF, Cilium, Docker et les conf√©rences tech.

item.title: eBPF and Go: The Core of Modern Kubernetes Networking
item.description: Exploring how eBPF and Cilium are revolutionising Kubernetes networking - improving observability, security, and scalability.

item.title: Working in regulated industries, QA to SWE, and public speaking
item.description: Discussing my transition from QA to software development, working in aerospace, moving to startups, contributing to open source, public speaking, and co-authoring a Go book.

item.title: Go, Community, and Learning
item.description: Discussing my diverse career journey, from image processing and electronics to Go development in the cloud-native space, community leadership, and balancing career with motherhood.

item.title: Build a Glamorous Habit Tracker Using Charm CLI
item.description: Learn to build beautiful terminal applications with Charm CLI tools - creating a habit tracker with style using Bubble Tea, Lip Gloss, and more.

item.title: So many Go books, so little time!
item.description: Interview with Jonathan Hall and Adelina Simion about my journey, working at Isovalent on Cilium, and co-authoring Learn Go with Pocket-Sized Projects.

item.title: Learn Go with Pocket-Sized Projects
item.description: With my co-authors Ali√©nor Latour and Pascal Bertrand, we discuss what makes Go tick and share strange bugs we’ve encountered across our diverse experiences as software engineers.

item.title: √Ä la d√©couverte de Go
item.description: Une introduction au langage Go - d√©couverte des fondamentaux, d√©mo en direct, et networking autour d’un verre.

item.title: ‚Äçüë©üèΩ‚Äçüåæ 2022: Time to Harvest
item.description:
If I had to describe 2022 in three words: community, travel, and fatigue.

Like many of us, I am looking toward the past at this end of the year, by writing a few lines. When a cycle is finished, I do appreciate looking back just to enjoy the new one coming. In reality, cycles are part of our life without being calendars. Talking about calendars, I tend to prefer birthdays instead of the new year. I feel 2022 is a watershed moment in my life, and I wanted to set it in stone by writing this article.

item.title: 2022: Time to Harvest
item.description: A reflection on 2022 - a year of community building, public speaking, and personal growth. Discussing accomplishments, challenges, and learnings from a transformative year.

item.title: Learn Go with Pocket-Sized Projects
item.description: Co-authoring a book at Manning to teach Go through end-to-end projects with Ali√©nor Latour and Pascal Bertrand.

item.title: TinyGo: Getting the Upper Hen
item.description: A practical introduction to TinyGo through a real-world project - monitoring a hen house with microcontrollers, sensors, and Grafana dashboards.

item.title: TinyGo: Getting the Upper Hen
item.description: A practical introduction to TinyGo through a real-world project - monitoring a hen house with microcontrollers, sensors, and Grafana dashboards.

item.title: Do's and Don'ts moving to Go microservices architecture
item.description: Best practices and lessons learned when transitioning to a Go microservices architecture - what to do and what to avoid.

item.title: Do's and Don'ts moving to Go microservices architecture
item.description: Best practices and lessons learned when transitioning to a Go microservices architecture - what to do and what to avoid.

item.title: TinyGo: Getting the Upper Hen (Long Version)
item.description: An extended deep-dive into TinyGo through building a hen house monitoring system - covering hardware setup, sensor integration, and data visualization.

item.title: My GopherCon Europe 2022 Highlights
item.description:
Last week, I gave my first talk on a stage at a conference with a mic and everything: this happened at GopherCon Europe. It was an amazing and enriching experience. I wanted to share with you the story behind it and a sum up of the talks I attended.

TL;DR: If you are only interested in the recap of the conference, you can skip directly to the ‚ÄúBerlin, an underground city‚Äù section.

item.title: My GopherCon Europe 2022 Highlights
item.description: A detailed recap of my first conference talk experience at GopherCon Europe 2022 in Berlin - from preparation to delivery, including talks attended and amazing people met.

item.title: TinyGo: Getting the Upper Hen
item.description: My first major conference talk! A practical introduction to TinyGo through monitoring my hen house with microcontrollers and sensors.

item.title: Tiny Hen
item.description: Monitoring my hen house using TinyGo - reading temperature and humidity sensors and displaying data on Grafana dashboards.

item.title: Honey, Let's Shrink The Gophers! (TinyGo Introduction)
item.description: An introduction to TinyGo for beginners - my first ever tech talk, delivered remotely for Women Techmakers Berlin.

item.title: TinyGo Exploration
item.description: Sample Go codes for microcontrollers - a collection of experiments and learning materials for TinyGo.

item.title: ChangeBlogging my first Hacktoberfest 2021
item.description:
How I discovered the vast open source world thanks to the Hackoberfest.

Three weeks ago, while going through the last posts on Hashnode, I landed on Beginners‚Äôs guide to Hacktoberfest 2021 post from Ayushi Rawat.

Hacktoberfest, in its 8th year, is a month-long celebration of open source software run by DigitalOcean. During the month of October, we invite you to join open-source software enthusiasts, beginners, and the developer community by contributing to open-source projects.

item.title: ChangeBlogging my first Hacktoberfest 2021
item.description: Walking through one month of my open source contributions during Hacktoberfest 2021 - overcoming fears, making first contributions, and discovering the rewarding world of open source.

item.title: Open Source Contributions
item.description: Contributing to various open source projects including revive (Go linter), TinyGo drivers, and GoBadge.
